720040f-a.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Lexington Avenue
720040f-a.text:
52 to 6l Gramercy Park North (where tall building are facing), at,
adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Lexington Ave., showing the
three units (16, 6, and 16-stories) of the Gramercy Park Hotel (No. 52);
a 16-story apartment house (No. 6O), and the 9-story Calvary Parish
House (No. 61), as seen across Gramercy Park from Srving Place. In the
foreground appears Gramercy Park South; on the left, low buildings on
Gramercy Park West, and in the right background, a view north of
Lexington Ave. from its starting point at Gramercy fark North. Note
also (left background) the tower of the Metropolitan Life IInsurance
Building. The name of Gramercy Park is said to be derived from Krom
Moerasje (Crooked Little Swamp) formed by Cedar Creek, which formerly
flowed from Madison Square to the East River. The present park once
formed part of a large farm acquired in 1761 by dames Duane, once Mayor
of New York City and by him christened ''Gramercy Seat''. It is an
exclusive park, not open to the public; in the center of which appears a
statue of Edwin Booth in the role of Prince Hamlet.
About 1932.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
SN ~ 72

720042f-b.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Lexington Avenue
720042f-b.text:
(1)
Gramercy Park North (buildings thereon) east from Lexington Ave.,
to and including Gramercy Park East (right background), and showing
a full view of Gramercy Park in a northeasterly direction from
Gramercy Park South, south side, between Irving Place and Fourth Ave.
July 7, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720041f-a.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Lexington Avenue
720041f-a.text:
Gramercy Park North, south side, west from Lexington Ave., to Gramercy
Park West (western boundary of fenced area). This thoroughfare when west
of the latter point regains its original identity as East 21st Street
and proceeds across Fourth Ave. At the S.E. corner of the latter two
points is the huge Rex Cole Building.
August 5, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720041f-a.folder: Gramercy Park North & Lexington Avenue, Manhattan, NY

720043f-a.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Lexington Avenue
720043f-a.text:
Gramercy Park North (where buildings are facing), north side, at
Lexington Ave., showing (right to left) No. 1 Lexington Ave., at the
N.E. corner of Gramerey Park North, the Hotel Gramercy Park, at the
N.E. corner of Lexington Ave., consisting of two 16-story units separated
by a 6-story one, and No. 60, 16-story apartment hotel, as seen across
Gramercy Park from Gramercy Park South. On the left appears a portion
oof Gramercy Park West.
About 1932.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
